17:03 <vmassol1> nice blog post gdelhumeau: http://gdelhumeau.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Blog/LESS+in+XWiki+Post+Mortem+of+an+integration :)

17:26 <vmassol1> gdelhumeau: can I edit the doc?  
17:26 <vmassol1> (you have a lock)  
17:26 <gdelhumeau> yes go

18:45 <tmortagne> has quit  
19:09 <eromano> has joined #xwiki  
19:10 <eromano> Hello. I've got a scheduler job in xwiki that does some database backups (to a NAS). I'm having permissions peculiarities. Do these job somehow not run as the same user that runs xwiki?  
19:39 <OSIMasson> has quit  
19:42 <\_cjd\_> has quit  
19:50 <vmassol1> eromano: if you edit your job you'll be able to specify under what user it'll execute  
19:51 <vmassol1> (you need to edit it using the object editor though, we have no specialized UI for this advanced feature yet)  
19:51 <vmassol1> is now known as <vmassol>  
19:51 <vmassol> the field is called "Job execution context user"  
19:51 <vmassol> if not specified, then the user who clicked "shcedule" for the job will be used
